_intro001.title: Introduction
_intro001.description:
A Cloud Security Specialist is responsible for securing cloud-based systems and data. They ensure that cloud environments such as AWS, Azure, and GCP are protected against unauthorized access, data breaches, and other cyber threats.

Learn more from the following resources:

_skills002.title: Skills Required
_skills002.description:
A Cloud Security Specialist should master:
- Cloud architecture and deployment models
- Identity and access management (IAM)
- Security monitoring and compliance
- Encryption and data protection techniques
- Threat detection and incident response in cloud environments

_tools003.title: Tools and Technologies
_tools003.description:
Common tools used by Cloud Security Specialists include:
- Cloud-native security tools (AWS Security Hub, Azure Security Center, GCP Security Command Center)
- SIEM and monitoring platforms
- Firewalls and VPN solutions
- Encryption and key management tools

These tools help in monitoring, detecting, and mitigating cloud-specific threats.

_careerpath004.title: Career Path
_careerpath004.description:
Career progression for a Cloud Security Specialist may include:
- Senior Cloud Security Specialist
- Cloud Security Architect
- Cloud Security Consultant
- Chief Information Security Officer (CISO)

Certifications such as CCSK, CCSP, AWS Certified Security, and Azure Security Engineer can boost career growth.
